meanings.sent1: After being left out in the sun, the clay started rehardening.
meanings.sent2: The chocolate began rehardening after being in the fridge for a while.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream was rehardening so fast, it felt like a race against time to eat it.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was rehardening, like steel being forged in a fire.
meanings.sent5: The rehardening of the cement made it nearly impossible to remove the stain.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming hard again.
meanings.sent1: The rehardening of the bread made it difficult to chew.
meanings.sent2: The rehardening of the clay sculpture preserved its shape over time.
meanings.sent3: The rehardening of the glue turned it into a solid mass in the bottle.
meanings.sent4: The rehardening of the lava created a new layer of rock on the volcano.
meanings.sent5: The rehardening of the ice on the lake signaled the start of winter.
